content.1: How I became a Software Engineer
It started in the '90s when my parents bought our first computer. It quickly became a fundamental part of my activities and entertainment.
content.4: I started building my first custom computers and scripts.

content.1: I initially considered this my first big failure, as it took me time to accept I wasn't going to finish my Telecom degree
content.3: However, I've come to appreciate this experience as it helped me identify my weaknesses and laid the groundwork for what my career would become in the future; I took my first coding steps here 👣

4.content: As I loved coding, I decided to pursue a career in Software Development, and planned carefully my next steps: I became a self-taught developer, worked part-time as an IT technician, and got a diploma in Cross-platform Software Development.

content.1: I secured an internship in an Edinburgh-based consultancy, so I left my comfort zone and devoted myself to making the most out of this opportunity.
content.2: It was my first Web Developer experience 🎉

content.1: Became part of an awesome crew that worked towards eliminating seafood waste by providing transparency and certainty into the current market. As one of their first employees, I quickly become involved in many areas outside of coding, shifting my role from Software Developer to Software Engineer 🎖️
content.2: This experience also helped me develop a product and user-first mindset through participating in multiple design sprints, user interviews, and having extreme ownership of what we built.

content.1: I decided to take some time off to work on personal projects
content.3: and do some personal development. I also tried to relocate to NZ and continue my journey in the other hemisphere, but this had to be postponed as it was not the right moment.

content.1: Joined Optix in my first specialised role as a Front-end developer. I was excited as this opportunity allowed me to fill the gaps in some areas I didn't experience while working in a start-up environment.
content.2: On top of that, I met specialised teams full of highly skilled people who set new standards for me every day. Exciting! 🤩

me.description: My name is Guillermo, and I love ideating and building stuff ❤️
me.content: I'm a Full-Stack Engineer with a strong product mindset cultivated by engaging with users, analysing problems, and participating in every aspect of the software development life cycle.

content.1: I'm proud of the diverse skills I've developed throughout my journey. They've been instrumental in my past accomplishments and serve as a solid foundation for my goal of becoming a specialised generalist.
I consider myself calm and friendly; always seeing the good in people. I don't like to jump to conclusions quickly and enjoy debating ideas to learn more about how others think.
content.2: A bit of a shy extrovert, I'm comfortable in small groups and -
content.3: despite getting nervous in front of bigger audiences
content.4: - feel happy to present my ideas to larger and non-technical audiences.
content.5: When it comes to working as part of a team, I enjoy helping others as it's always a good learning opportunity and preserves the team's momentum.
